name: discolor
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to (cause something to) change from the original color and therefore to look unpleasant: The heat from the fire had discolored the paintwork.

to cause a substance or material to change from its original color when you do not want it to: [ T ] Direct sunlight will discolor this fabric. discoloration noun [ C/U ] us
